newsitem.title: LEBANON: Beirut t-bill issue raises 322.5 bln pounds.
newsitem.headline: Beirut t-bill issue raises 322.5 bln pounds.

text.p: Lebanon's weekly treasury bill issue of February 20 raised 322.5 billion Lebanese pounds ($208.9 million), and the Bank of Lebanon for the first time limited the award of three- and six-month bills to non-competitive bids.
The previous issue raised 358.6 billion pounds.

The central bank said only 10 percent of all competitive bids, those made by Lebanese institutions, were accepted up to the discount rate and yield for three-month bills. The acceptance rate was 14 percent for six-month bills, 10 percent for 12-month and 15 percent for two-year bills.
However, all non-competitive bids for 12- and 24-month bills were accepted, the Bank said.
The issue posted a nominal surplus of subscription against maturity of 62.8 billion pounds. It raised the following amounts (in billion of pounds, pervious week in brackets):
The Lebanese pound closed at $1,548.25 to the U.S. dollar on Monday from $1,548.75 a week earlier and 1,588 a year ago.
